ags:resource.dc:title: Foliárna aplikácia nitrolenolu zvyšuje toleranciu rastlín čakanky k suchu

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Exogenous application of nitrophenol enhanced chicory drought tolerance

dc:creator.ags:creatorCorporate: Slovak University of Agriculture, Nitra, Slovak Republic

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In the pot vegetation experiments conducted in semi-controlled environmental conditions, we studied the effect of foliar application of p-nitrophenol on the water parameters of chicory (Cichorium intybus var. sativa). Plants treated with p-nitrophenol and grown in conditions of well watersupply of soil significantly increased the dry weight of the root system (WR). On the other hand, the dry weight of the above-grown parts (WAG), the size of the leaf area (A) and specific leaf area (SLA) were significantly unaffected. Finally, the foliar application of p-nitrophenol in well hydrated plants unaffected the relative water content (RWC) of leaf and the stomatal conductance (gs). However, p-nitrophenol in a well hydrated plants significantly reduced the osmotic potential(psís), induces a increase of the capacity for osmotic adjustment (OA). This result was confirmed by the increased accumulation of proline. The chicory plants treated of p-nitrophenol and exposed to progressive soil dehydration significantly resulted in a slower decline in RWC, gs as well as increase capacity for OA and proline concentration. We concluded that foliar application of biostimulative substance p-nitrophenol increased the ability of chicory plants to tolerate soil dehydration, which gives less reduction of growth and dry matter production plants.
